6. OTC medications - Same active ingredients, FDA regulated. Paying more doesn't make ibuprofen work better.
7. School supplies - Crayola makes many store brands. Your kids can't tell the difference.
8. Pet supplies - Same manufacturers as Petco/PetSmart brands, 40-50% less.

twitter_content_templates.hook_tweet: I worked at a discount store for 3 years. Here are the secrets they don't want you to know about saving money
thread_structure: I worked at a discount store for 3 years. Here are the secrets they don't want you to know about saving money
1. Restock days matter. Most stores restock Wed/Thurs. This is when you find the best new clearance items before they're picked over.
2. The 'end caps' (displays at end of aisles) are often overstock or soon-to-be-clearance. Check back in a week for markdowns.
3. Damaged packaging = automatic discount if you ask. That dented box of trash bags? Ask a manager for 10-20% off.
4. Seasonal items go clearance exactly 2 weeks after the holiday. Mark your calendar.
5. 'Closeout' items won't be restocked. If you love it, buy multiples NOW.
6. The app coupon + manufacturer coupon + clearance price can stack. I once got $40 headphones for $8.
7. Most stores will price match their own online prices if you show them on your phone.
What other retail secrets do you want to know? I've got stories for days
